trans-unit.source: Defines the base class for events providing Web-request information.
The WebRequestEvent is raised at every Web request.
It uses the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebRequestInformation> class to obtain request information.
> [!NOTE] > In most cases you will use the standard ASP.NET health-monitoring types and control their behavior by setting the `healthMonitoring` configuration section.
You can also create custom types, as shown in the next example.
If you create your custom event type and you need to add your own information, customize the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent.FormatCustomEventDetails%2A> method.
This will avoid overwriting or tampering with sensitive system information.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.Management.WebRequestEvent"></xref> class with specified event parameters.
The constructor WebRequestEvent allows specifying the event message, the source of the event, and the code or identifier associated with the event.
The message associated with the event.
The object that is the source of the event.
The <xref href="System.Web.Management.WebEventCodes"></xref> code associated with the event.
It must be greater than <xref href="System.Web.Management.WebEventCodes.WebExtendedBase"></xref>.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.Management.WebRequestEvent"></xref> class with specified event parameters.
The constructor WebRequestEvent allows specifying the event message, the source of the event, the code or identifier associated with the event, and the detailed code.
The message associated with the event.
The object that is the source of the event.
The <xref href="System.Web.Management.WebEventCodes"></xref> code associated with the event.
It must be greater than <xref href="System.Web.Management.WebEventCodes.WebExtendedBase"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.Management.WebEventCodes"></xref> detail code associated with the event.
Used internally to increment the performance counters.
Gets the information associated with the Web-application request.
The standard request information is defined by the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebRequestInformation> class.
The information associated with the Web-application request.
